messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Introducting myself
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Carol!  I haven t officially introduced myself either.  I am Jana and live next door in KY.  We are looking forward to that trip and glad you enjoyed
messages.messageBody:
Hi Carol! I haven't "officially" introduced myself either. I am Jana and live next door in KY. We are looking forward to that trip and glad you enjoyed yourself and the place a couple weeks ago. I also have boys who are 17, 15, 12 & 10, the younger 2 are the only ones at home now. Nice to "meet" you. :) Jana, Genaro & boys in Lexington

pioneer66523 <pioneer66523@...> wrote: Hi all. I've been joined for a little while now and finally got up
the nerve to post.

My name is Carol, 37 years old, married, live in Indiana, happy mama
to 3 wonderful teenage boys, 18,16 and 14. I'm a happy, radical
unschooler who is married to an ex-math teacher but somehow we've made
it work! ;)

I was just going through some of the older posts and saw the trip to
the Kalahari Resort planned in January. We were just there for the
1st time two weeks ago. It is an amazing place and I think we are
going to try and make it there for the Unschooling Convo. I can't
imagine how much MORE fun that will be with a group of unschoolers there.

CarolM in Indiana

messages.subject: Introducting myself
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all.  I ve been joined for a little while now and finally got up the nerve to post. My name is Carol, 37 years old, married, live in Indiana, happy mama to
messages.messageBody:
Hi all. I've been joined for a little while now and finally got up
the nerve to post.

My name is Carol, 37 years old, married, live in Indiana, happy mama
to 3 wonderful teenage boys, 18,16 and 14. I'm a happy, radical
unschooler who is married to an ex-math teacher but somehow we've made
it work! ;)

I was just going through some of the older posts and saw the trip to
the Kalahari Resort planned in January. We were just there for the
1st time two weeks ago. It is an amazing place and I think we are
going to try and make it there for the Unschooling Convo. I can't
imagine how much MORE fun that will be with a group of unschoolers there.

CarolM in Indiana
